item.title: Report X-2024070235
item.description:
Report X-2024070235

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection 2 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of Zep concentrated industrial purple degreaser. 1 X 1 gallon plastic bottle of degreaser had a loose cap allowing 1 gallon to release, soiling the other 1 X 1 gallon plastic bottle of degreaser. No slotted partition or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024070211
item.description:
Report X-2024070211

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A POSSIBLE HAZMAT LEAKER AT PACKAGE CAR. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER FOUND A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH WET CORNERS. USING DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS RESPONDER CAREFULLY LOADED THE PACKAGE ONTO A SPILL TRAY LINED WITH GREEN BAG AND PROCEEDED TO CLEAN UP THE SURROUNDING AREA. THEN BROUGHT THE PACK BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PD7 IRREG-BELT FOR A POSSIBLE HAZMAT LEAKER. UPON ARRIVING RESPONDER FOUND THE HAZMAT BOX WITH A LITTLE SPILLAGE ON THE FLOOR. USING DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS RESPONDER CAREFULLY TRANSFERED THE HAZMAT ONTO A SPILL TRAY LINED WITH GREEN BAG AND CLEANED UP THE SURROUNDING AREA. THEN BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024070179
item.description:
Report X-2024070179

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DA/OVERGOODS AREA FOR A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. FOUND A HAZMAT BOX WITH A LITTLE WET SPOT ON THE TOP CORNER. USING DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CAREFULLY EXAMINED THE PACKAGE AND LOADED IT ONTO A SPILLED TRAY LINED WITH GREEN BAG AND PROCEED TO CLEAN THE AREA AND THEN BROUGHT THE HAZMAT PACKAGE BACK FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024070123
item.description:
Report X-2024070123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 12 HOUR RESPONDER SUMMONED TO RECYCLE CHUTE FOR AN OPEN BOX WITH LEAKING CONTENTS. RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE, CONSULTED DECISION TREE RESPONSE SHEETS, TRANSPORTED THE PKG BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THE SIDE OF THE BOX WAS TORN, AND THE PAIL INSIDE WAS PROTRUDING FROM THE BOX. THE PAIL LID WAS SLIGHTLY AJAR, AND POWDER WAS LEAKING OUT. THE PAIL HAD A 5.1 OXIDIZER DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL, "UN 2468" "TRICLOROISOCYANURIC ACID, DRY" PRINTED ON THE PAIL. THERE WERE NO INDICATIONS OF A DANGEROUS GOOD ON THE OUTSIDE CARTON OR THERMAL LABEL. THE BOX HAD NO MANUFACTURER MARKS, UN SPEC MARKS, OR ANY INDICATION OF THE BOX STRENGTH. SHIPMENT CALLED INTO HMSC AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. PKG AWAITING CLEARANCE FOR DMP DAMAGE PROCESSING IN ETT.

item.title: Report X-2024061878
item.description:
Report X-2024061878

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Alexander Bretz, 042 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN1294, Toluene, 3, PG II spill on the dock floor. Alexander advised the forklift operator was attempting to load the drum when he punctured the drum with the forklift causing the spill. Safety asked if any struck the yard, and Alexander advised not yet. Safety asked if he would be able to contain the spill to the dock area. Alexander advised yes. Alex with CURA was contacted for remediation. Alexander contacted Safety advising approximately 5 Gallons struck the yard. Safety advised Cura regarding the spill to the yard.

item.title: Report X-2024061897

item.title: Report E-2024060667
item.description:
Report E-2024060667

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN1791 Dynachlor release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 10 x 30 area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by dunnage. The material was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. Absorbents and citric acid were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents were collected into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 4th 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024061665

  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package found leaking by package handler, 3481098, when she picked it up and felt it was wet on the bottom. She immediately reported it to her manager who flagged QA for inspection. She immediately washed her hands but reported residual tingling sensation while under stress. QA found during inspection one bottle sideways and having leaked.

item.title: Report E-2024060677
item.description:
Report E-2024060677

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: MCKEES ROCKS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon pail after a fall during loading/offloading. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents and recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum along with the spent PPE and damaged pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024061845

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: REPORTED TO DOOR 141. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE ROLLER LINE. BOX WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM CORNER. NO LIQUID ON THE ROLLER LINE OR ON THE FLOOR UNDER IT. NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024060682
item.description:
Report E-2024060682

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of battery acid was released from three large batteries that were damaged during transit. The release impacted the trailer and asphalt dock. ERTS dispatched Miller Environmental Group to assist with cleanup. Miller Environmental Group deployed neutralizer, absorbents, and cleaned the impacted areas. The damaged batteries and recovered material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.
